title: Global Finance Watchdog Censures Turkey Over Money Laundering, Terrorist Financing
sub_head: The Financial Action Task Force adds Turkey to its list of monitored countries, adding to economic turmoil
body:
WASHINGTON—A global watchdog on Thursday added Turkey to its list of countries requiring special regulatory oversight for failing to stop money laundering and terrorist financing, a designation analysts say will rattle Anakara’s already shaky economy.
The action means Turkey joins a group of 23 countries—including Zimbabwe, Haiti and Syria—that the Financial Action Task Force determined “have strategic deficiencies in their regimes to counter money laundering, terrorist financing, and proliferation financing.”
